ygData.subject: On a Rational Basis for Utilization of a Fitness Approximation vs. Actual Eval
ygData.msgSnippet: In instances in which fitness evaluation is non-trivial, effective utilization of computational resources can translate into broader successful applicatility

Subject: On a Rational Basis for Utilization of a Fitness Approximation vs. Actual Eval
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=281645563; y=Tlk71NSLBODM4_3W7Nqa6okEUKQN5LK2RLjRhoYgbe5aTA

In instances in which fitness evaluation is non-trivial, effective 
utiliza=
tion of computational resources can translate into broader 
successful appl=
icatility of evolutionary methods to practical real-
world problems. 

This=
 is especially true in instances in which local-search 
methodology is util=
ized employing numeric gradients derived from 
finite difference based jaco=
bian or broyden update.

On the first order, there is prevention of duplica=
tive fitness 
evaluations via utilization of historical data.

Closely rela=
ted to this is the leveraging of "close" prior fitness 
evaluations, so as =
to minimize expensive actual fitness evaluation, 
via either reuse or appro=
ximation/interpolation.

The concept of "close" includes considerations of =
both hypervolume 
distances and local slopes of the fitness hypersurface. 
=

Furthermore, the decision to utilize a cheap approximation over an 
expens=
ive actual fitness evaluation, requires some means of 
quantification of ma=
ximum error as a decisional threshold.

One approach to achieve this object=
ive, is the application of the 
assumption of local lipschitz continuity to=
 the fitness hypersurface:

( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lipschitz_contin=
uity )

This assumption provides a mechanism for calculation of the maximum=
 
error subsequent to a determination of the local lipschitz constant.

One=
 useful implementation of this approach to multivariate scattered 
data int=
erpolation, is the LibLip library by Gleb Beliakov:

( http://www3.it.deaki=
n.edu.au/~gleb/lip.html )

In which the prior actual fitness evaluations 
c=
onstitute "multivariate scattered data."
